home.title: The MGA Rendezvous
home.subtitle: Where Europe welcomes the world
home.tagline: Where risk appetite meets risk focus
home.description: The MGA Rendezvous, hosted by FASE at Hotel Arts, Barcelona, 11-12 May 2026, offers European MGAs and insurers and reinsurers from around the world a unique opportunity to develop business opportunities together.
home.hero_summary: Over two days, the Rendezvous will bring MGAs, capacity providers and select service providers together in a structured format – a unique opportunity to build relationships and develop business.

networking.title: Building relationships and growth opportunities
networking.description1: Over two days, the Rendezvous will bring MGAs, capacity providers and select service providers together in a structured format to build relationships and pursue profitable growth opportunities.
networking.description2: Our comprehensive program is designed to foster collaboration and growth across the European MGA ecosystem through exclusive networking events, expert panels, and business matchmaking sessions.

cta.title: Join the European MGA community
cta.description: The FASE Rendezvous is currently in development. Join our community to be the first to know about this upcoming flagship networking opportunity.

premier.title: Europe's premier MGA networking event
premier.content1: Over two days, FASE's annual conference will bring together MGAs, capacity providers and selected service providers to expand business opportunities across Europe. Our primary focus will be on fostering networking and relationship-building opportunities, but we are also planning an event programme that sets the standard for European MGA events.

attendees.title: Who should attend
attendees.intro: The MGA Rendezvous brings together key participants in the European delegated underwriting market:
attendees.list:
• Managing General Agents with deep expertise in European markets
      • Insurance and reinsurance companies and Lloyd's syndicates seeking to deploy capacity through selected MGA partnerships
      • Service providers supporting the MGA ecosystem

fase.title: About FASE
fase.subtitle: Fédération des Agences de Souscription Européennes
fase.description: FASE is the pan-European federation established to serve the needs of Europe's managing general agents, connecting them with insurance capacity providers, distributors, investors and service providers. We share best practices in a rapidly growing sector of the market, offering an array of informational and educational services for MGAs.

speakers.title: Latest Thinking
speakers.banner_alt: Industry leaders and experts from across the European MGA ecosystem

lineup.title: Your forum for ideas
lineup.content1: The MGA Rendezvous is a forum for ideas as well as people. We are assembling a world-class speaker panel to share perspectives and insights on the direction of the market, including:
lineup.content2:
• How capacity options for European MGAs are expanding and diversifying

      • How MGAs are enhancing performance – and the strength of their carrier relationships – through novel AI-powered technologies

      • How the US MGA market – currently five times the size of the European market in premium terms – may offer pointers to the future of the European MGA market

      • How a patchwork quilt of regulation hinders international MGA growth in Europe – and how to tackle it

expertise.title: Industry expertise across Europe
expertise.content1: Our speakers bring decades of expertise from across the European MGA ecosystem, delivering market insights from industry leaders and market experts who understand the challenges and opportunities facing European MGAs.
expertise.content2: Expect deep analysis of market trends, latest developments in technology and business models, plus proven strategies and practical insights from successful MGA operations across European markets.

cta.title: Be the first to know
cta.subtitle: Speaker announcements coming soon
cta.description: Speaker announcements will be made to registered participants first. Register your interest to be notified when our impressive speaker lineup is revealed.

thank_you.title: Thank You for Your Interest
thank_you.message: We have received your registration for MGA Rendezvous. We will be in touch with event details and ticket information as they become available.

company.title: Company Information
company.name: Company Name
company.fase_member: This company is a FASE member (50% discount for all attendees)

additional_info.title: Additional Information
additional_info.special_requests_placeholder: Any special accommodation requests or notes

form.privacy: By submitting this registration, you agree to our

people.title: People
people.content_hero: The FASE advisory board, together with our sponsors (Howden, Accelerant, and Clyde & Co), bring deep experience in matters affecting MGAs in the European insurance market. With their engagement, we will be assembling a comprehensive agenda and world class speaker panel for the MGA Rendezvous.

place.title: Place
place.content1: Founded by the Phoenicians, Barcelona has always been a trading city. As such, it is a fitting location for the inaugural MGA Rendezvous, drawing MGA founders and executives from across Europe and insurance and reinsurance company executives from around the world.
place.content2: The Hotel Arts, our conference hotel, overlooks the Mediterranean and is a short walk from the city center and within easy access of Barcelona's international airport.

ideas.title: Ideas
ideas.intro: MGA markets across Europe are developing rapidly but are at different stages of evolution. This offers considerable scope for cross-pollination of ideas and best practices from one market to another.
ideas.agenda_intro: Among the issues on our agenda in Barcelona will be:

topics.capacity: How European MGAs can diversify their capacity options and design capital structures suited to their business needs
topics.technology: How MGAs can enhance performance – and the strength of their carrier relationships – through novel AI-powered technologies
topics.us_market: How the US MGA market – currently five times the size of the European market in premium terms – may offer pointers to the future of the European MGA market
topics.regulation: How a patchwork quilt of regulation impedes international MGA growth in Europe – and how to tackle it

hero.title: Local Expertise, Global Capacity
hero.description: MGAs wrote close to €20 billion in premium in Europe in 2024, fueled by capacity sourced from around the world. The MGA Rendezvous offers global insurers and reinsurers a unique opportunity to engage with the foremost risk experts in Europe across a wide range of business classes.

growth.title: Sustained Growth
growth.description: Europe's MGAs have been growing at 20%+ for the past five years

scale.title: Market Scale
scale.description: Continental Europe is home to around 650 MGAs and the UK to a further 300

talent.title: Talent & Capital Magnet
talent.description: European MGAs are magnets for talent and capital – and their pull is strengthening

technology.title: Technology Leaders
technology.description: Europe's MGAs include many of the most technologically advanced companies in global insurance

footer.title: The MGA Rendezvous
footer.description: Pan-European MGA networking event by FASE - connecting MGAs, capacity providers and service providers across Europe.

code_of_conduct.title: FASE Code of Conduct
code_of_conduct.introduction:
FASE supports the highest professional and ethical standards, as described in this Code of Conduct, and requires that all members commit annually to upholding these standards as a condition of their membership.

Members hereby undertake to act in a legal, fair and ethical manner in all their dealings with all parties.

Members undertake to cooperate fully and at all times with FASE in its enforcement of this Code.

legal_responsibilities.title: 1. Legal responsibilities
legal_responsibilities.content:
Members will comply with all applicable laws and regulations in the locations in which they do business. Should this legal responsibility conflict with another duty described in this Code, this legal responsibility will take priority.

Members will bring to the attention of the FASE Business Conduct Committee any circumstances of which they become aware involving:

• A member being in breach of any regulatory requirement and

• Any circumstance that may reasonably lead to sanctions against the member or a member of their staff or directors by the relevant regulatory authorities

Members will provide all reasonable lawful assistance to regulatory, professional and law enforcement organization in the discharge of their duties, whether in respect of themselves, another Member or a non-member.

financial_responsibilities.title: 2. Financial Responsibilities
financial_responsibilities.content:
Members should always meet their financial obligations on time. This includes, but it not limited to, payment of debts, premium due to insurers, returns due to brokers and insureds, sums due to employees.

Members must comply with applicable solvency or like requirements.

inter_organizational_responsibilities.title: 3. Inter-organisational Responsibilities
inter_organizational_responsibilities.content:
Members will compete fairly and honourably in the markets in which they operate.

This includes, but is not limited to:

• making no statement about fellow Members, competitors or other market participants, privately or publicly, which they do not honestly believe to be true and relevant based on the best information reasonably available to them;

• entering into any agreement intended to diminish competition within the market.

community_responsibilities.title: 4. Community Responsibilities
community_responsibilities.content:
FASE members must conduct themselves in a manner befitting the privileges of membership.

Members will not only comply with their obligations under law pertaining to discrimination, but in all their dealings will take reasonable steps not to cause a detriment to any person or organisation arising from race, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, pregnancy and maternity, married or civil partnership status, religion or belief, age and disability.

Members are encouraged to take part in civic, charitable and philanthropic activities which contribute to the promotion of the good standing of the insurance sector, its contribution to the public good and the welfare of those who work in it.

Members will encourage continuing education and training for staff.

insurer_relationships.title: 5. Relationships with Insurers

broker_relationships.title: 6. Relationships with Brokers and Agents (or Insureds if operating directly)
broker_relationships.content:
Members should deal fairly and honestly with brokers, agents or insureds (if operating directly), and in so doing will:

• consider at all times the financial stability of insurers with which the Member places business;

• make no false or misleading representation of what coverage is being provided, or the limitations or exclusions to coverage or impose limitations or exclusions such that the policy provides no effective benefit to the insured.

Members should be able to demonstrate that they have carefully considered the insurers that they represent as underwriting agents and place their and their brokers' customers' business with.

Effective and appropriate due diligence is a key part of the process that Members should perform on the insurance companies they represent as security for the policies they provide. There is a risk to customers in the event that an insurer fails and is unable to pay valid claims.

FASE expects MGA Members to be able to demonstrate that suitable due diligence has been performed on the insurers that they represent and offer as insurance security.

Members should provide clear and unambiguous detail of the name and address of the insurer in all the relevant documentation provided for brokers and policyholders. We expect Members to positively avoid giving the policyholder the impression that the MGA is the insurer and obscure the name of the insurer behind the MGA. It is important that customers can make an informed decision on where their insurance is being placed.

breach_reporting.title: Breach Reporting
breach_reporting.content: All notices of potential breach made under this Code should be made to: Chairman of the Business Conduct Committee, FASE, Herengracht, 124-128, 1015 BT Amsterdam, Netherlands.
